org.jtrim.event

Interface EventCauses

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEventCauses

    public interface EventCauses
    Defines the chain of events leading to a specific part of a code in the execution.

    How the causing events are tracked is in general implementation dependant. However, this interface was designed for EventTracker implementations which can keep track of events and provide the causes of events.

    Thread safety

    Implementations of this interface must be immutable and as such safe to be accessed by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Implementations of this interface are required to be synchronization transparent.
    See Also:
    AbstractEventCauses, EventTracker, TriggeredEvent

      Checks if there is an event amongst the causes with the given event kind.

    • Method Detail

      • getNumberOfCauses

        int getNumberOfCauses()
        Returns the number of causing events defined by this EventCauses.

        This method returns the same number as the number of events the Iterable returned by the getCauses() method contains.

        Returns:
        the number of causing events defined by this EventCauses. This method always returns an integer greater than or equal to zero.

      • getCauses

        java.lang.Iterable<TriggeredEvent<?>> getCauses()
        Returns the causing events, iterated in backward order as they have occurred. That is, the first event returned by this Iterable is the immediate cause and the last one is the root cause.

        The Iterable returned by this method will iterate over as many elements as returned by the getNumberOfCauses() method.

        None of the elements of the returned Iterable are null values.

        Returns:
        the causing events, iterated in backward order as they have occurred. This method never returns null.

      • getArgumentsOfKind

        java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Object> getArgumentsOfKind(java.lang.Object eventKind)
        Returns the event arguments of the causing events having the specified event kind. The arguments are iterated in backwards order as they have occurred. That is, in the same order as iterated by the Iterable returned by the getCauses() method but different kind of events are filtered out.
        Parameters:
        eventKind - the kind of the causing events to be returned. This argument can be null, in which case an empty Iterable is returned because there can be no cause with null event kind.
        Returns:
        the event arguments of the causing events having the specified event kind. This method never returns null.

      • isCausedByKind

        boolean isCausedByKind(java.lang.Object eventKind)
        Checks if there is an event amongst the causes with the given event kind.

        The equivalence is based on the equals method.

        In case this method returns true, the getArgumentsOfKind returns a non-empty Iterable.

        Parameters:
        eventKind - the kind of the event to be checked if there is such event amongst the causes. This argument can be null, in which case this method returns false.
        Returns:
        true if there is an event amongst the causes with the given event kind, false otherwise

      • isCausedByEvent

        boolean isCausedByEvent(TriggeredEvent<?> event)
        Checks if the specified event is amongst the causes.

        The equivalence is based on the equals method. That is, this method looks for events of the same kind and argument.

        Parameters:
        event - the event to be checked if it is amongst the causes. This argument can be null, in which case this method returns false.
        Returns:
        true if the event is amongst the causes, false otherwise
